;;周一，操作员在 A-Gas Rapid Recovery DFW 设施中移动用过的制冷剂钢瓶， 2023 年 10 月 9 日，德克萨斯州阿灵顿。 （美联社照片/Sam Hodde）;
;

;Jennifer Byrne 在美国宾夕法尼亚州费城拥有一家供暖和空调维修公司。

;

;空调或交流设备，冷却家里的空气。为此，该设备使用一种称为制冷剂的气体。

;

;在房屋内的空调设备上工作时，伯恩将设备中的气体放入特殊容器中。

;

;该气体是其工业名称为：R-410A。科学家表示，它在大气中捕获的热量是二氧化碳的 2,088 倍。

;
;;;2023 年 9 月 14 日星期四，Comfy Heating and Cooling 的所有者兼技术员 Jennifer Byrne 在费城的空调冷凝器装置上工作。（美联社照片/Joe Lamberti）;< /div>;

;由于化学制冷剂会吸收热量，因此有人说需要用其他制冷剂代替。一些科学家担心甲烷、二氧化碳和其他气体的释放会使大气变暖。

;

;《清洁空气法》禁止企业故意向空气中释放制冷剂。一些公司正在尝试寻找吸收热量较少的替代气体，这可能也能起到同样的作用。

;

;家庭空调设备泄漏是气体进入大气的一种方式。 Eckhard Groll 表示，汽车是这些污染物的另一个;来源;。他是制冷专家，也是印第安纳州普渡大学机械工程系主任。

;

;他说汽车中的空调装置可能会泄漏。他说，平均而言，每年所有汽车中约有 25% 的制冷剂会泄漏。格罗尔说，仅美国就有超过 2 亿辆汽油车。 Groll 表示，根据这些数字，他估计每年约有 4500 万公斤制冷剂泄漏到大气中。

;
;;;在这张 2007 年 3 月 13 日的资料照片中，一名购物者在新泽西州劳伦斯维尔的 Acme 超市购买牛奶产品。 （美联社照片/梅尔·埃文斯，档案）;
;

;超市是第二大泄漏源。长管道将制冷剂输送到储存食物的冷却器。丹妮尔·赖特 (Danielle Wright) 是北美可持续制冷委员会的负责人，该委员会是一个位于加利福尼亚州米尔谷的非营利组织。它支持更清洁的冷却方法。

;

;Wright 表示，超市每年平均泄漏约 25% 的制冷剂。该数字基于美国环境保护署 2005 年的报告。

;

;她批评超市，称“……泄漏制冷剂比构建防漏系统;更便宜;。 ”

;

;限制泄漏很重要，因为制冷剂可以重复使用。许多企业;回收;制冷剂气体。其中一家公司 A-Gas 于 1993 年在英国成立。该公司在美国设有多个中心

;
;;;2023 年 10 月 9 日星期一，德克萨斯州罗姆市的 A-Gas Rhome 工厂中，操作员正在准备排出旧钢瓶中剩余的制冷剂。 （美联社照片/Sam Hodde）;
;

;A-Gas 美洲区总裁 Mike Armstrong 表示，制冷剂可以多次使用，可持续使用 30 年。该公司从美国各地和其他国家进口制冷剂和容器。它对气体进行处理以出售和再次使用。他说他的生意做得很好。

;

;“这个行业在未来几年内可能会增长四到五倍，”阿姆斯特朗说。

;

;化学工业也在寻找寻找替代 R-410A 的化学品。一些研究人员认为二氧化碳本身就是一种可能性。但普渡大学的格罗尔表示，二氧化碳必须在高压下才能用作制冷剂。需要完全不同的设备。

;

;Christopher Cappa 在加州大学戴维斯分校教授环境工程。他说，“如果我们将二氧化碳从大气中提取出来”，它将会很有用。但他补充说，“如果我们只是将其作为制冷剂生产，那效果不一定那么好。”

;

;;制冷比空调更容易清洁;;

;可持续制冷委员会的赖特支持使用二氧化碳。 “这是一种;轻而易举的成果;，它是一项已知的技术和市场准备好了，”她说。

;

;然而，她表示减少空调泄漏更加困难。她表示，化学品和设备制造商以及现有的建筑规则减缓了美国新型制冷剂的增长

;

;但制造商特灵科技 (Trane Technologies) 表示，它一直在努力寻找不同的选择。特灵表示，它的制冷剂对环境的破坏比现有制冷剂减少了 78%。该公司表示将从 2024 年开始在其设备中使用它。

;
;;;哈佛大学化学和化学生物学助理教授贾拉德·梅森 (Jarad Mason) 拥有一种可恶的钴基混合材料，2023 年 9 月 14 日，星期四，在马萨​​诸塞州剑桥市学校校园的一个实验室中。（美联社照片/Steven Senne）;
;

;在哈佛大学，研究人员正在努力开发一种固体制冷剂而不是气体。哈佛大学化学和化学生物学助理教授 Jarad Mason 正在研究这个项目。

;

;他说他对使用固体材料充满希望，因为它们既可以用于大型建筑，也可以用于普通家庭。

;

;“供暖和制冷的需求只会增加，”他说。他补充说，研究人员必须找到不损害环境且成本低廉的冷却方法。

;

;我是安德鲁·史密斯。我是吉尔·罗宾斯。

;;加利福尼亚州塞巴斯托波尔 Pax Wines 的实习生赤脚踩有机葡萄2023 年 9 月 8 日，大桶中取出果汁开始发酵过程。（美联社照片/Haven Daley）;
;

;采用古老方法酿造的葡萄酒正在赢得新的粉丝。

;

;葡萄酒是一种由葡萄等水果制成的酒精饮料。

;

;天然葡萄酒采用减少加工和对地球有害影响的方法。研究公司 IWSR Drinks Market Analysis 发现越来越多的美国人寻求天然葡萄酒。与此同时，自 2015 年以来，葡萄酒购买者的数量一直在下降。

;

;2021 年，天然和其他地球友好型葡萄酒仅占销售额的不到 1%。但对这些葡萄酒的需求增长速度比订购和运输葡萄酒及其他酒类的在线网站 Drizly 报道称，总体上还有其他种类。

;

;大多数天然葡萄酒都是用手工采集的有机葡萄酿制的。有机种植者不使用有毒化学品来阻止或控制昆虫或; ;不需要的植物生长。

;

;为了酿造葡萄酒，需要将葡萄压碎。有些葡萄酒生产商像古代人一样用脚踩碎葡萄。之后，压碎的葡萄自然;发酵;。制造商不添加水、酵母或其他物质。

;

;也有例外。一些天然酿酒师添加亚硫酸盐，这是一种葡萄中天然产生的化学物质。额外的亚硫酸盐可以帮助保存或保存葡萄酒。一些酿酒师清除了最终液体中任何可能使其看起来浑浊的小碎片。

;

;结果是葡萄酒具有泥土味，并且比大生产商生产的许多葡萄酒更难以预测。

; < div >;;;Erin Coburn，奥克兰 minimo 葡萄酒商店的老板， 2023 年 9 月 7 日，加利福尼亚州，她在她的品酒吧里倒了一杯天然葡萄酒。（美联社照片/Haven Daley）;
;

;“第一次品尝它时，你就能看出它是活的， ”约翰·凯勒说。他是密歇根州北部 Neu Cellars 的老板和酿酒师。

;

;但是销售天然葡萄酒工艺可能很困难。天然葡萄酒在美国没有固定的定义，它并不容易找到，因为大多数天然葡萄酒在其;标签;上都没有这样的标识。

;

;“天然葡萄酒听起来不错，但是;传统;葡萄酒也很天然，”Anita Oberholster 说道。她是加州大学戴维斯分校葡萄栽培和酿酒学系的教授。 “如果天然葡萄酒的理念要发展，我们应该对其进行研究并对其进行定义。”

;

;Neu Cellars 的凯勒拥有生物化学学位。他开始为加利福尼亚州的一家大型酿酒师工作。但他离开了，因为他对公司使用的所有化学混合物不满意。其中包括明胶、橡木粉和鸡蛋。

;

;但是，有人说天然葡萄酒和传统葡萄酒之间的界限非常狭窄。

;

;添加到葡萄酒中的许多产品（例如酵母）都是天然的奥伯霍尔斯特说。许多传统葡萄酒是在不添加任何物质的情况下酿造的。

;

;一些业内人士希望为生产天然葡萄酒制定规则; ;。法国葡萄酒行业在 2020 年采取了此类行动，制定了酿酒师必须满足的要求，才能将其葡萄酒认定为天然葡萄酒。

;

;一些制造商认为，这些规定可能会提高葡萄酒酿造成本。凯勒使用有机葡萄，但他表示，他无法承担为批准有机葡萄酒而进行重复检查的费用。

;

;张东是葡萄酒投资公司 Vinovest 的联合创始人兼首席执行官。他看到了另一个问题。

;

;Vinovest 表示，一些葡萄酒公司正在从缺乏规则中获利。他认为，他们使用诸如图像之类的标签内容来表明他们的葡萄酒酿造是自然的，但实际上并非如此。这可能会误导买家，他们往往会为使用自然方法的小型生产商生产的葡萄酒支付更高的价格。< /p>;

;不过，买家可能很快就会获得更多有关酒瓶的信息。从 12 月开始，在欧盟销售的葡萄酒必须在标签上标明每种产品所含的所有物质。

;

;Oberholster 预计美国在未来几年也将通过类似措施。

;

;Oberholster 预计美国也将在未来几年通过类似措施。 >;

;我是格雷戈里·斯塔切尔。

; Thu, 19 Oct 2023 06:07:03 +0800 How Google“s Antitrust Trial Could Change the Internet Search Markethttps://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/how-google-s-antitrust-trial-could-change-the-internet-search-market/7316294.html
;;2023 年 10 月 18 日星期三 22:05:33 GMT;
;;
;;周三，Google 标志出现在该公司纽约新大楼的入口处，2023 年 9 月 6 日。;
;

;美国一家法院正在听取针对搜索引擎提供商 Google 的案件的证据。政府指控该公司使用非法方法压制商业竞争对手。

;

;美国司法部正在华盛顿特区的一家法院主导针对谷歌的案件

;

;审判可能会发生变化Google 未来被允许开展业务的方式。该案是美国历史上最大的反垄断审判之一。反垄断是一个与旨在防止非法竞争的法律相关的术语。

;

;如果初审法官做出有利于政府的裁决，由此产生的惩罚可能会给个人用户和企业带来新的在线搜索可能性。

;

; >;

;Google 的搜索引擎通过帮助人们快速连接到互联网上提供的丰富信息而赢得了巨大的市场份额。 Google 联合创始人拉里·佩奇 (Larry Page) 和谢尔盖·布林 (Sergey Brin) 在 20 世纪 90 年代末开发了搜索技术。

;

;司法部认为 Google 在市场上拥有不公平的优势，因为其搜索引擎是;默认;; 全球最受欢迎的智能手机和网络浏览器的选择。

;

;;蜜蜂和其他昆虫聚集在 Agro Brasilia 的向日葵上，这是一个农业展览巴西巴西利亚郊区，2012 年 5 月 18 日。（美联社照片/Eraldo Peres，档案）;
;

;一项新研究表明，世界气候和土地利用的变化正在急剧减少所需昆虫的数量用于;授粉;作物。

;

;这项研究考察了世界各地的数千个物种和地区。研究发现，在异常高温和开花植物供应减少期间，授粉昆虫的数量下降了 61%。

;

;该研究的领导者指出，蜜蜂、苍蝇、飞蛾和其他授粉媒介受到的影响比一般昆虫种群。研究结果最近;出现;在《科学进展》出版物中。

;

;“我们看到气候变化已经对传粉媒介产生了非常强烈的;影响;，”研究合著者蒂姆·纽博尔德告诉美联社。他是大学学院的生态学家。伦敦。

;

;美国农业部估计，世界上约 35% 的粮食作物和 75% 的开花植物依赖昆虫和其他动物授粉媒介进行繁殖。

;

;研究发现，最大的传粉媒介丧失的问题出现在热带地区——靠近地球赤道的地区。因授粉媒介减少而面临作物损失风险最大的国家包括中国、印度、印度尼西亚和巴西。撒哈拉以南非洲地区也面临危险，特别是其可可和研究发现，芒果作物。

;

;鉴于目前的情况，研究人员表示，一些重要的热带作物，尤其是咖啡和可可，可能会受到严重损害。这些植物严重依赖蜜蜂和苍蝇来帮助繁殖。

;

;过去的研究表明，昆虫数量正在减少，原因有多种，包括气候变化和;栖息地;丧失。; ;其他研究表明传粉昆虫的数量正在减少，其中咖啡和可可植物因缺乏而受到的损害尤其严重。

;

;伦敦大学学院的纽博尔德表示，他看到“气候变化的双重打击” “影响咖啡植物本身，以及它们所依赖的传粉媒介。

;

;然而，这并不意味着不会有咖啡或巧克力可用，该研究的主要作者 Joe Millard 说。这只是意味着买家将不得不为它们支付更多费用。 Millard is a computational ecologist at the Natural History Museum in London.

;

;University of Delaware insect expert Douglas Tallamy – who was not part of the research – said this study is unusual because it centered on the tropics, which other research has not. “We're not paying enough attention to the tropics,” Tallamy said. “They are important.”

;

;Newbold noted that pollinating insects in the tropics are likely hit harder than other places because they are already near their temperature limits that place them at risk. “Massive warming in the tropics is pushing those species over the edge,” Newbold said.

;

;Habitat loss is the main driver for the shrinking number of pollinators because it leaves less food for them, Millard said. Climate change, ;parasites;, disease, and chemicals in the environment add to that difficulty.

;

;Newbold said scientists are still trying to find out why pollinators seem to be suffering worse effects from warming temperatures than other insects. It could be because they have hairier legs and bodies that help them carry ;pollen;, the researchers said.

;

;It is like “being forced to have a big furry coat and it's getting hot,” Newbold said.

;

;But the University of Delaware's Tallamy is not so sure. He said that the study's data is solid, but its explanation as to cause of impact is more of a ;guess;.

;I'm Bryan Lynn.

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 06:07:03 +0800 Pepper X Sets Guinness Record for Hottest Pepperhttps://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/pepper-x-sets-guinness-record-for-hottest-pepper/7314437.html

;;A Pepper X pepper is shown on Tuesday, Oct. 10, 2023, in Fort Mill, SC The pepper variety is now the hottest pepper in the world according to the Guinness Book of World Records (AP Photo/Jeffrey Collins);
;

;Ed Currie is the pepper expert who grew the Carolina Reaper, which has been considered the hottest pepper in the world since 2013. Ten years later, Currie broke his record with one that is three times hotter: Pepper X.

;

;The Guinness Book of World Records named Currie's latest creation the world's ;“hottest chili pepper”; this month.

;

;Guinness uses what are called Scoville Heat Units (SHU) to measure heat in a chili pepper. A normal jalapeno pepper registers about 5,000 units. A habanero, the record-holder about 25 years ago, reaches 100,000 SHU.

;

;The Carolina Reaper held the record since 2013 with 1.64 million SHU. And Pepper X is the new record holder with an average of 2.69 million units. By comparison, pepper spray commonly carried by police is around 1.6 million units. And bear spray, a product to keep bears away, is advertised to have 2.2 million units.

;

;Currie said when he first tried Pepper X, “I was feeling the heat for three-and-a-half hours.” Currie, one of only five people so far to eat an entire Pepper X added, “Then the ;cramps; came.” The cramps, he said, left him lying in pain for another hour.

;
;;;Ed Currie holds up his certification that his new Pepper X variety of peppers is the hottest in the world according to the Guinness Book of World Records on Tuesday, Oct. 10, 2023, in Fort Mill, SC (AP Photo/Jeffrey Collins);
;

;Currie started working on Pepper X after he set the record in 2013 with the Carolina Reaper. He ;crossbred; 100 different kinds of peppers every year for 10 years. Currie hoped that just one or two would make it through the development process. His goal was to offer an extremely hot pepper flavored with a little sweetness.

;

;Pepper X is greenish yellow. It is a crossbreed of a Carolina Reaper and, what Currie mysteriously called, a “pepper that a friend of mine sent me from Michigan that was brutally hot.”

;

;The chemical in peppers that causes the burn is called capsaicin. The chemical causes a burning sensation when it touches human tissue. The burning sensation is also said to release chemicals into the body called endorphins and dopamine.

;

;Currie started growing peppers after ending drug and alcohol ;addictions;. He considers that sensation a natural “high.” He shares his peppers with medical researchers, hoping they can use them to treat disease and help people who suffer ;chronic; pain or discomfort.

; ;

;Currie is trying to build a business with his new creation. In the past, Currie permitted people to grow his peppers without protecting his ideas. His lawyers say they have counted more than 10,000 products that use the Carolina Reaper name, or other ;intellectual property;, without permission.

;

;For Pepper X, he said no seeds will be released without his permission. “Everybody else made their money off the Reaper. It's time for us to reap the ;benefits; of the hard work I do,” Currie said.

;

;Currie wants people to eat peppers and thinks they can gain from the experience that comes after the burn. He warns people from reaching too quickly for a Carolina Reaper or Pepper X.

;

;When asked if Pepper X is the “pinnacle” or the hottest a pepper can be, Currie said with a smile, “No, it's not the pinnacle.”

;

;I'm Jill Robbins.

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 06:07:03 +0800 UN Report: Education Technology Should Be Used Carefullyhttps://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/un-report-education-technology-should-be-used-carefully/7305179.html
;;Tue, 17 Oct 2023 22:05:46 GMT;
;;
;;FILE - Michael Burton-Straub, left, and Declan Lewis attempt to "Find the Bot" in Donnie Piercey's class at Stonewall Elementary in Lexington, Ky., Monday, Feb. 6, 2023. (AP Photo/Timothy D. Easley);
;

;The COVID-19 pandemic showed how useful digital technology could be for schools. But it also showed the limitations of technology in the educational setting. Millions of students were able to attend classes online to avoid spreading the virus. But many students failed to learn by such methods. Their educational progress slowed and in some cases went backwards.

;

;Digital tools and the internet have made it easier for students to ;access; educational resources. However, a large number of schools around the world remain unconnected to the internet. Additionally, digital tools have entered markets that have no official supervision. Such educational products do not require any testing or proof as to their value to schools and learners.

;

;The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) argues against unsupervised wide use of digital tools and AI in education. A recent UNESCO report says there is little evidence that wide technology use improves learning. The organization says digital educational tools can never replace the human connection of teacher and student.

;

;Audrey Azoulay is UNESCO's Director General. She says there is a very large divide, or gap, between rich and poor countries when it comes to digital resources. Just 40 percent of primary schools worldwide have access to the internet, she said. Many schools also lack electricity, especially in Africa and Central and Southern Asia. In sub-Saharan Africa, just 32 percent of schools have electricity.

;

;And, internationally, about one-third of students were unable to attend online classes during the pandemic.

;

;“Even if connectivity was universal, it would still be necessary to demonstrate …that digital technology offers real added value in terms of effective learning,” the report says.

;

;Often, technology changes faster than it is possible to study it, the report says. Educational technology products change every three years on average. In Britain, for example, just seven percent of educational technology companies had done studies to judge the effectiveness of their products.

;

;UNESCO also reported that many companies pay for studies on the effectiveness of their own product. These studies are not independent examinations.

;

;Pearson, an education technology company, has a tool called Successmaker for teaching math and reading. Independent studies show the tool has little or ;negative; effectiveness in learning. But the company stands by the results of the private study it paid for. That study found the product very helpful to learning.

;

;UNESCO says such companies need to be better regulated. Azoulay said just 14 percent of countries require data protection in education.

;

;“Student data should not be used either by education technology or advertising technology companies for marketing purposes,” the report says. Yet a study of 163 products found that 89 percent of them gathered student data and sent them to third-party companies, often for advertising purposes. This usually happened without the student or parent knowing, the study said.

;

;UNESCO argues that technology holds great possibilities for education. But studies have shown that educational technologies are most effective when a teacher is involved in the ;instructional; process.

;

;“We must never forget the social and emotional ;dimensions; of teaching and learning,” Azoulay said, adding, “no screen will ever replace a teacher.”

;

;I'm Dan Novak.

;

;

;

;The International Monetary Fund (IMF) said recently that China's weak economic recovery could hurt Asian economies.

;

;The IMF also said the risk of a longer property crisis in China could present additional risks.

;

;China's economic gains after the government eased COVID-19 restrictions lost strength earlier than expected, the lending group said.

;

;The IMF said the strength of the US economy has offered less support to Asia than in the past. That is because US economic growth has mainly taken place in the service industry, which does not increase demand for exports very much.

;

;Problems in China's heavily indebted property, or real estate, ;sector; and the resulting economic slowdown will likely affect other countries in Asia in the near future. The IMF added countries that export raw materials to China will likely be affected.

;

;The IMF said a longer real estate crisis and limited policy action in China would deepen the economic slowdown in the area.

;

;The IMF released its ;World Economic Outlook; during its yearly meetings held this year in Marrakesh, Morocco. The IMF cut next year's growth estimate for Asia to 4.2 percent from 4.4 percent ;projected; in April.

;

;"Any time China slows, it has a ;bearing; on the ;global; economy, notably...Asia," said Krishna Srinivasan. He is director of the IMF's Asia and Pacific Department.

;

;Asia is seeing inflation slow sooner than other parts of the world. But central banks there should not quickly cut interest rates as core inflation remains, Srinivasan said.

;

;Core inflation measures the rate at which prices for many products rise. But it does not include prices for things like food or energy which can change quickly.

;

;"Central banks should ;stay the course;," he said. He added the conflict in the Middle East could cause inflation to increase.

;

;;Effects of Japanese policy;

;

;The IMF said Japan's central bank made small changes to its financial policy. Those changes affected other countries. The international lender said this is because of the larger presence of Japanese investors in the international bond market.

;

;The IMF said such effects could become larger in the event of further action taken by Japan's central bank to control its economy.

;

;The Bank of Japan (BOJ) has aimed to limit interest ;yield; for its 10-year bonds to support its economy.

;

;Central banks around world have put in place policy measures to combat rising prices of goods and materials. As this happened, the BOJ last year began to ease its yield limit. The moves were widely seen by markets as Japan's steps towards easing government policies of massive spending.

;

;Some researchers say a large interest rate increase in Japan could greatly affect financial markets. They worry it would increase the cost of borrowing for companies and investors across the world.
